question: How are notes the go off the stave drawn?
In treble clef, what is the note above the stave with no added lines?
In treble clef, what is the note above the stave with one added line through it?
In treble clef, what is the note above the stave with one added line underneath it?
In treble clef, what is the note above the stave with one line through it and one underneath it?
In treble clef, what is the note above the stave with two lines underneath it?
In treble clef, what is the note below the stave with no added lines?
In treble clef, what is the note below the stave with one added line through it?
In treble clef, what is the note below the stave with one added line above it?
In treble clef, what is the note below the stave with one line through it and one line above it?
In treble clef, what is the note below the stave with two lines above it?
In bass clef, what is the note above the stave with no added lines?
In bass clef, what is the note above the stave with one added line through it?
In bass clef, what is the note above the stave with one added line underneath it?
In bass clef, what is the note above the stave with one line through it and one underneath it?
In bass clef, what is the note above the stave with two lines underneath it?
In bass clef, what is the note below the stave with no added lines?
In bass clef, what is the note below the stave with one added line through it?
In bass clef, what is the note below the stave with one added line above it?
In bass clef, what is the note below the stave with one line through it and one line above it?
In bass clef, what is the note below the stave with two lines above it?
